xxl.core.collections.containers.recordManager

Class RecordManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.collections.containers.AbstractContainer
      • xxl.core.collections.containers.recordManager.RecordManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Container, Convertable

    public class RecordManager
extends AbstractContainer
implements Convertable
    This class is an extension of Container which implements a record manager on top of a given Container.

    Note, that this Container is only able to deal with Objects which are Blocks. Although the insert and update methods expect/return Objects, these Objects will be castet to Block. The intenal identifyer are TIds (tuple identifier) or identifyer supported by the TIDManager used.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecordManager

        public RecordManager(Container container,
                     int pageSize,
                     Strategy strategy,
                     TIdManager tidManager,
                     int numberOfDirectReserves)
        Creates a new record-manager which uses the given strategy and TIdManager.
        Parameters:
        container - the container in which the RecordManager stores its Blocks.
        pageSize - size of each page inside the base container.
        strategy - The strategy used for placement of records.
        tidManager - A manager which is able to handle identifyers.
        numberOfDirectReserves - number of slots for reserve operations inside each page.

      • reserve

        public Object reserve(Function getObject)
        Reserves an id for subsequent use. In order to reserve some space, the size of the Object must be known and since we need the real Object to get the needed size, we insert the Object yet, instead of inserting only some dummy-bytes. The given Function must return the Object. Return a TId-Object that indicates the Page-ID and the Position of the inserted Object in this Page.
        Specified by:
        reserve in interface Container
        Specified by:
        reserve in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        getObject - A parameterless function providing the object for that an id should be reserved.
        Returns:
        the reserved id (a TId-Object)
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - - if an object with an identifier id is not in the container.

      • update

        public void update(Object id,
                   Object object,
                   boolean unfix)
            throws NoSuchElementException
        This method updates the given object inside the RecordManager. If the new size of the record requires that the record has to be moved to a different physical location, the identifyer always stays the same.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Container
        Specified by:
        update in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the Object.
        object - the new object that should be associated to id.
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - - if an object with an identifier id does not exist in the container.

      • insert

        public Object insert(Object object,
                     boolean unfix)
        Inserts a new object into the container and returns the unique identifier that the container has been associated to the object. The identifier can be reused again when the object is deleted from the container. If unfixed, the object can be removed from the buffer. Otherwise, it has to be kept in the buffer until an unfix() is called.
        After an insertion all the iterators operating on the container can be in an invalid state.
        This method also allows an insertion of a null object. In the application would really like to have such objects in the container, some methods have to be modified.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Container
        Overrides:
        insert in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        object - is the new object.
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the object.

      • remove

        public void remove(Object id)
        Removes the object with identifier id. An exception is thrown when an object with an identifier id is not in the container.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Container
        Specified by:
        remove in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        id - the identifyer of the object which will be removed.

      • numberOfPages

        public int numberOfPages()

        Returns:
        number of pages.

      • getSpaceUsagePercentage

        public double getSpaceUsagePercentage()
        Returns the percentage of the pages which are full. The optimal value is nearby 1 but never reaches 1 because of the extra data that has to be stored for each record.
        Returns:
        the space usage percentage.

      • ids

        public Iterator ids()
        Returns an iterator that delivers all the identifiers of the container that are in use. The Iterator supports remove(), but the remove Operation is performed after the end of traversing the ids (when hasNext returns false for the first time).
        Specified by:
        ids in interface Container
        Specified by:
        ids in class AbstractContainer
        Returns:
        an Iterator over the identifiers.

      • objects

        public Cursor objects()
        Description copied from class: AbstractContainer
        Returns a cursor containing all objects of the container. The order in which the cursor delivers the objects is not specified.
        The default implementation filters the iterator that is returned by the method ids() by dropping all ids that doesn't contain an object. The objects are retrieved from the container by using the method get().
        Specified by:
        objects in interface Container
        Overrides:
        objects in class AbstractContainer
        Returns:
        a cursor containing all objects of the container.

      • checkConsistency

        public void checkConsistency()
        Checks the consistency of the internal structure with the Pages of the RecordManager. If there is a problem, then a RuntimeException is thrown.
